intro: Santiria schlechteri, commonly known as the mountain santiria, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy slopes, thriving in cool and humid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, while its flowers are small and yellowish, arranged in dense clusters. Santiria schlechteri is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for potential medicinal properties.
